channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OpenAI, Anthropic, and Block Are Teaming Up to Make AI Agents Play Nice
item.description: American AI giants are backing a new effort to establish open standards for building agentic software and tools.

item.title: The 51 Best Shows on Hulu, WIRED’s Picks (December 2025)
item.description: To Cook a Bear, The Manipulated, and Chris Hemsworth: A Road Trip to Remember are just a few of the shows you should be watching on Hulu this month.

item.title: OpenAI Hires Slack CEO as New Chief Revenue Officer
item.description: A memo obtained by WIRED confirms Denise Dresser's departure from Slack. She is now headed to OpenAI.

item.title: OpenAI Staffer Quits, Alleging Company’s Economic Research Is Drifting Into AI Advocacy
item.description: Four sources close to the situation claim OpenAI has become hesitant to publish research on the negative impact of AI. The company says it has only ex...

item.title: The Best Karaoke Speakers from Small and Portable to Massive
item.description: Looking to make karaoke night a regular thing? We’ve tested everything from Bluetooth speakers to full-blown PAs.

item.title: Three in 10 US teens use AI chatbots every day, but safety concerns are growing
item.description: While teenagers may start out using AI chatbots for basic questions, their relationship with chatbot platforms has the potential to turn addictive.

item.title: Why Cursor’s CEO believes OpenAI, Anthropic competition won’t crush his startup
item.description: After reaching $1 billion in annualized revenue, Anysphere CEO Michael Truell explained the features his company is focused on building out.

item.title: B Capital founding partner Kabir Narang leaves to launch new investment platform
item.description: Kabir Narang is laying the groundwork for a new investment platform slated for 2026.

item.title: SpaceX reportedly planning 2026 IPO with $1.5T valuation target
item.description: The company is looking to raise $30 billion, which would make it the biggest IPO ever, just ahead of Saudi Aramco's in 2019.

item.title: Rivian is building its own AI assistant
item.description: The EV maker will likely share more details on its upcoming AI & Autonomy Day scheduled for December 11.
